title: Understanding the Inverse Property
text: To transform a function into a similar form, any value can be applied as long as its inverse is also in the function. For example, $$x=3+x-3$$ or $$x=\frac{4}{4} x$$.
speech: To transform a function into a similar form, any value can be applied as long as its inverse is also in the function. For example, ; x is equal to, 3 plus x minus 3  or  x; is equal to 4 fourths x; .
